resources.string: Your Mel instance wants to get to know another one.
This notification prevents Mel from being shut down.

Left column: all other Mel instances known to you. When clicking on one of them the right column will show all existing services. Ticking the boxes will allow the other instance to talk to this specific Service.

You can create new Services here. Remember: Services are not allowed to \"talk\" to any other instances by default. You can change that in the Access view. Before a service can be created you must grant the required permissions so it can do its job.
Shows the current status of the background service and some additional info. You can see all running services and settings in the navigator on the left.
Usually you do not need this. If something goes wrong and you cannot currently debug this is the place to look at.
Finds other instances of Mel in the current Wifi. This requires Broadcasting to be working on your network. Broadcast are sent on port 9966.
List of instances that your device already knows and can connect with. Currently connected instances are highlighted.

You can adjust your name and ports here. Your name will appear on other devices once paired. The ports are used to connect (directly - if broadcasting does not work) and Broadcast port is fixed to 9966. When you are done with coupling you may create new Services and allow them to \"talk\" to the other instances.
Shows things that you can change on this currently running Service.
Always do heavy work when plugged
Allow heavy work when WiFi is off
*Heavy work might drain your battery. It allows things like file indexing.

Welcome to Mel. This app can couple with other instances running on your network. When you have done that you may create a Service and grant access to the other instances. You will find a Help button on the top right which explains what all the things are good for.
Waiting for the other side to accept.
Max age of items in wastebin in days
The location permission ist needed to get proper Wifi information from Android. Eg: Android 8+ will not return an SSID if not granted. No location data is send anywhere. Tap here to grant permission.
You did not grant all necessary persmissions to run this service :(
Do you really want to delete that certificate? You won\'t be able to communicate until you pair again.
Cannot choose a working directory for the drive service unless you grant the required permission.

Write permission to external storage is required since Android introduced the storage access framework which is rubbish. So I replaced the java.io.File by something that works and requires the permission. Please grant the write permission in the next dialog and select the root directory of your external sd card thereafter.
Background service started. We can begin. Click next.
This is the name this device will have when it is connected to other devices. For privacy reasons your name will not be send to unknown devices.

Here you can adjust your power settings. You have two presets that you can fine tune in the table below. If the state changes to \'stop\' all background work and communications will be suspended to save some battery. If you plan to use this device as a daily driver stick to the \'mobile\' preset. The blue border is the current state. The toolbar will change its colour according to the state. Communications are down when the state is \'off\'.

If you want to synchronize data you have to install this software on another Android phone or Laptop/PC. Install Synchronisator there as well, set it up like this instance and continue with the next step.
Before your Devices can talk to each other you have to pair them. To do so both must be in the same network. Go to the menu \'Pair\'. The help button provides further assistance.
Tip on \'New Service\' in the menu. A Services provides data your devices can synchronize to others. Currently you can sync your phone book or whole directories.
Tap on \'Access\' and grant a paired device access to a service. (When you just created a service it is not allowed to talk to any device. This also means that it is invisible for those devices.)
You can re-run this dialog by going to \'Settings\' and tip \'Show Intro dialog\'.
Do you want do download it?
The server uses symbolic links which -unless you got root- are not supported on Android. A compatibility mode is currently not available.
The services asks for some permissions.
As this is a service that is supposed to synchronize contacts, you habe to grant the obvious permission in the next dialog.
Write permission is mandatory to write into the donwload directory (thats how Android works).
Write permission not granted - won\'t export
Please choose the external storage root.
Please choose the internal storage root.
